description: Back garden - The garden is 19m long and 6.5m wide and faces due south. There are 7 mature trees in our back garden or immediately adjoining.  The ash is c. 14m high and wide, the two Bradford Pears (marked B) c. 12m tall, the two palms c. 7m tall, the magnolia (marked M) c. 5m tall.  There are at least 8 very large shrubs over 3m tall (marked in green), mostly camellias, and many smaller shrubs and ornamental trees. We wish to remove the arbutus unedo (marked in red).  It is now more than 6m tall and 7m wide.  It stands 7m from the back of our house close to the garden wall separating us from 2 Lawn Crescent.  As the garden is only 6.5m wide, the arbutus now comes more than half way across our back garden and  largely blocks the view from our back room, which has large patio doors looking out onto the garden.  It also blocks light and sun in our courtyard garden, It has been damaged by high winds on two occasions, snapping off at the top of the bole, which has resulted in a very dense crown.  It has been pruned in 2015 and 2018 as it was getting too large, which only seemed to encourage it to grow faster, so that it was soon larger than before.
